tweet: I just visited Beard Brook last weekend and this is heartbreaking. Wishing all those impacted a complete recovery, and thank you to our first responders  for working around the clock to keep our communities safe. https://www.modbee.com/news/local/crime/article225286125.html …

If the government shuts down, those responsible should feel the consequences, not hardworking families back home.

I spoke today about the effort we’re leading to make this a reality. pic.twitter.com/eJVNBq3Ldv

"I have every confidence Josh Harder will be transparent and continue to have open communication with all his constituents." https://www.modbee.com/opinion/letters-to-the-editor/article225056060.html …

This shutdown should have never happened, but glad that the Pres. & leaders in both Houses have agreed to compromise. Let’s put this sad episode behind us so both sides can work on a permanent solution to fund our government, secure our border, & fight for Central Valley families
It's about showing up, listening, and getting to work. Read my latest Op-Ed here---> https://www.modbee.com/opinion/article225058460.html …

Great to see a familiar Turlock face today — thanks for stopping by Mayor @AmyBublak. Looking forward to working with you to make sure the Valley gets the federal resources it deserves. pic.twitter.com/Qebuld4cUF

I’m so grateful to everyone who shared their stories over the past week — please keep them coming. Every day this is my promise: Ill be accessible, I’ll listen, and I’ll fight for our communities. pic.twitter.com/jEOD0eGmSe

This week I travelled through #CA10 to hear from hundreds of you about what you think our families need. I wanted to quickly share what I’ve learned, and how we’re going to make it happen. Please keep the ideas coming! pic.twitter.com/C4CXTVhpwF

“I am not the representative of the people who agree with me, I am not the representative of people who voted for me. I’m the representative of every person in this district, and I really do hear you.” https://www.turlockjournal.com/news/government/shutdown-controversy-at-center-of-harders-first-town-hall/ …

Great to join Manteca’s Hope Family Shelter to do our part to celebrate #MLKDayOfService. Would love to hear from the rest of the community about how others in #CA10 gave back today. pic.twitter.com/TqgIcy5Z0x

Honored to join the Tracy, West, & Kimball HS BSU clubs, @TracyUnifiedSD, & the Tracy African American Association to celebrate the legacy of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. A reminder of how far we’ve come, & the work we’ve yet to accomplish so all can live in a just + equal world. pic.twitter.com/hxkC9U9jj7

Thanks to @beyerobotics for letting me stop by Sunday’s build day! STEM programs like this are key to our kids’ futures.

Proud to share our final committee assignment – I’ll be serving on the House Agriculture Committee allowing me to focus on one of the most vital pieces of our economy in #CA10. Ready to get to work for our farmers. https://harder.house.gov/media/press-releases/rep-josh-harder-receives-second-committee-assignment-will-serve-house …

The CA wildfires were devastating. Today we worked across the aisle and won an additional $1.9 billion to help farmers rebuild. We have lots more to do, but this is a start.

If you were effected by the wildfires call my office at (209) 579 5458 and we can help. pic.twitter.com/u8SLnrTXld

Thrilled to be on the House Ed & Labor Committee (and still TBD others). I ran to make a difference on issues that matter to  #CA10— good jobs, worker's healthcare and setting up the next generation for success. This gives us the voice to do just that. https://harder.house.gov/media/press-releases/rep-josh-harder-receives-first-committee-assignment-will-serve-house-education …

Our communities need this disaster recovery funding. I refuse to let it be taken from us. We have to put politics aside and have a real debate about how we properly secure the border. https://www.eenews.net/stories/1060111755 …

Yesterday for the first time I addressed Congress. I rose to speak because this government shutdown is directly hurting the Central Valley and it needs to stop. You can watch my first speech below. pic.twitter.com/fuTmXAO4LC

This is what is wrong with partisan politics. 

Immigration reform is needed, border security is needed. 

But we absolutely shouldn’t shut down the government because we can’t work together. Open the government and stop hurting families who need our government’s help.

Congrats to all our @SJGov and @StanCounty representatives who took the oath of office yesterday! Excited to work with you to make life better in the Central Valley! https://www.modbee.com/latest-news/article224060265.html …

31,000 families in my district are at risk of losing SNAP benefits to feed their kids because of this shutdown. It’s completely unacceptable that our working families are treated like political pawns. It's time we #EndTheShutdown immediately. https://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/government-shutdown-food-stamps_us_5c31070de4b0bcb4c25c4524?ncid=engmodushpmg00000004 …

Today, I signed on as a co-sponsor to H.R. 1, the For the People Act. There are a lot of issues we need to tackle in the new Congress, but the corrupting influence of big money in politics is the biggest obstacle to getting things done. Read my Op-Ed. https://www.modbee.com/opinion/article223928790.html …

Earlier today, I took the oath of office. Pam and I are so grateful for this moment, and I am humbled by the responsibility entrusted to me by the 10th District. Our office is open and ready to serve you! pic.twitter.com/4T9IxCIYZv
